name: 職場溝通專題研究
description: This course focuses on studies in workplace communications related to the HR function. HR personnel frequently use communication to carry out important job duties such as policy announcement, project presentation, job description, employee interviews, training delivery, performance feedback, bargaining and negotiation, etc. Some communications involve sensitive or private information; some are difficult (e.g., exit interviews, misconduct investigation, counseling on special conditions, etc.) Miscommunication often leads to employee dissatisfaction and low organizational efficiency. Therefore, effective communication becomes a critical issue for HR personnel, which takes a combination of appropriate media, environment, and skills. This course will cultivate graduate students’ ability to study workplace communication through discussion of issues, review of research methods, and development of related research.
goals: Enhance knowledge and theories to apply to research on workplace communications.
Understand the current research trend, practices and issues of workplace communications in human resource development.
Apply appropriate research and data analysis methods to the study of workplace communications.
syllabus:
16+2 weeks

Week 1  
Course introduction, syllabus review  
Week 2  
Introduction to workplace communications  
Week 3- 5  
Research trend in workplace communications  
Week 6- 8  
Research methods to study workplace communications  
Week 9-11  
Qualitative analysis in workplace communications research  
Week 12-14  
Statistical analysis in workplace communications research  
Week 15-16  
Reporting of workplace communications research  
Week 17-18  
Final report writing

methodologies.note: Use lecture to illustrate important concepts.
Let students discuss concepts and share their research in class.
Students apply the concepts learned in class into a research and write a report.

grading.note: Participate in class discussion on workplace communication.
Present reading assignment articles in class.
Apply concepts learned in class into a research and write a report.
